qas.question: How many theaters does London's West End have?
Where does Greenwich Mean Time marked?
What famous palace is located in London?
What is the name of the world's oldest underground railway?
How many World Heritage Sites can be found in London?

context: London contains <a4_0>four<a4_0/> World Heritage Sites: the Tower of London; Kew Gardens; the site comprising the Palace of Westminster, Westminster Abbey, and St Margaret's Church; and the historic settlement of Greenwich (in which <a1_0>the Royal Observatory, Greenwich<a1_0/> marks the Prime Meridian, 0° longitude, and GMT). Other famous landmarks include <a2_0>Buckingham Palace<a2_0/>, the London Eye, Piccadilly Circus, St Paul's Cathedral, Tower Bridge, Trafalgar Square, and The Shard. London is home to numerous museums, galleries, libraries, sporting events and other cultural institutions, including the British Museum, National Gallery, Tate Modern, British Library and <a0_0>40<a0_0/> West End theatres. <a3_0>The London Underground<a3_0/> is the oldest underground railway network in the world.
